result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Scholze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with KCM dob 1/7/1993 or her residence  The parties may communicate through a third party for child exchange purposes ONLY.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave the State of Wisconsin

(12:48)Defendant Michael J. Scholze in court, in custody via video with attorney Greg Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def is NOT eligible for SPD services;    Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Parties heard on bond; Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $20,000.00 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with KCM /7/1993; The parties may communicate through a third party for child exchange purposes ONLY.;  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave the State of Wisconsin Defendant Michael J. Scholze in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
